text: The 2016–17 Nemzeti Bajnokság I/A is the 86th season of the Nemzeti Bajnokság I/A, the highest tier professional basketball league in Hungary. == Teams == The following 14 clubs compete in the NB I/A during the 2016–17 season. Vasas Akadémia promoted as champions of the Division B, the second tier. {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Team ! Position 2015-16 ! City ! Arena ! Capacity |- | Alba Fehérvár | Runner-up | Székesfehérvár | Vodafone Sportcentrum | align="center" | 3,000 |- | Atomerőmű SE | 4th | Paks | ASE Sportcsarnok | align="center" | 1,520 |- | Falco KC | 9th | Szombathely | Arena Savaria | align="center" | 3,500 |- | Jászberényi KSE | 12th | Jászberény | Belvárosi Általános Iskola | align="center" | 1,000 |- | Kaposvári KK | 7th | Kaposvár | Városi Sportcsarnok | align="center" | 1,500 |- | Kecskeméti TE | 10th | Kecskemét | Messzi István Sportcsarnok | align="center" | 1,600 |- | BC Körmend | Third place | Körmend | Városi Sportcsarnok | align="center" | 1,740 |- | MAFC | 13th | Budapest | Gabányi László Sportcsarnok | align="center" | 700 |- | PVSK-Panthers | 8th | Pécs | Lauber Dezső Sportcsarnok | align="center" | 3,700 |- | Soproni KC | 6th | Sopron | NOVOMATIC Aréna | align="center" | 2,500 |- | SZTE-Szedeák | 11th | Szeged | Újszegedi Sportcsarnok | align="center" | 3,000 |- | Szolnoki Olaj KK | Champion | Szolnok | Tiszaligeti Sportcsarnok | align="center" | 2,551 |- | Vasas SC | 1st (NB I/B) | Budapest | Sport11 Csarnok | align="center" | 1,000 |- | Zalaegerszegi TE | 5th | Zalaegerszeg | Városi Sportcsarnok | align="center" | 2,000 |} ===Personnel and kits=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="font-size:95%; text-align: left;" |- ! Date of appointment |- |align="left"|Egis Körmend | align="left"| Teo Čizmić |rowspan="3"| Resigned | 10 December 2016 | 2nd | align="left"| Gasper Potocnik | 12 December 2016 |- |align="left"|Sopron KC | align="left"| Balázs Sabáli | 7 January 2017 | 10th | align="left"| Dragan Aleksić | 8 January 2017 |- |align="left"|Szolnoki Olaj KK | align="left"| Stojan Ivković | 7 January 2017 | 7th | align="left"| Zoran Kmezić | 10 January 2017 |- |align="left"|Atomerőmű SE | align="left"| Gediminas Petrauskas | Mutual consent | 7 January 2017 | 12th | align="left"| Teo Čizmić | 10 January 2017 |} == Regular season == ===Results=== == Second round == ===1st – 5th placement matches=== ====Results==== ===6th – 10th placement matches=== ====Results==== ===11th – 14th placement matches=== ====Results==== ==Playoffs== Teams in bold won the playoff series. Numbers to the left of each team indicate the team's original playoff seeding. Numbers to the right indicate the score of each playoff game. ===Quarter-finals=== In the quarterfinals, teams playing against each other had to win three games to win the series. Thus, if one team wins three games before all five games have been played, the games that remain are omitted. The team that finished in the higher regular season place, played the first, third and the fifth (if it was necessary) games of the series at home. {| class=wikitable style="text- align:center" !style="width:275px; text-align:right;"|Team 1 !style="width:80px;"| !style="width:275px; text-align:left;"|Team 2 !style="width:70px;"|Game 1 !style="width:70px;"|Game 2 !style="width:70px;"|Game 3 !style="width:70px;"|Game 4 !style="width:70px;"|Game 5 |- | align=right|Alba Fehérvár || 3–0 || align=left|KTE-Duna Aszfalt || 89–79 || 80–72 || 98–69 || — || — |- | align=right|Falco-Vulcano Energia KC Szombathely || 3–1 || align=left|Kaposvári KK || 82–72 || 71–78 || 78–76 || 84–77 || — |- | align=right|EGIS Körmend || 3–1 || align=left|PVSK-PANNONPOWER || 81–95 || 88–82 || 87–75 || 103–89 || — |- | align=right|Zalakerámia ZTE KK || 3–2 || align=left|Szolnoki Olaj KK || 79–76 || 77–94 || 85–68 || 75–83 || 85–69 |} ===Semi-finals=== In the semifinals, teams playing against each other had to win three games to win the series. Thus, if one team wins three games before all five games have been played, the games that remain are omitted. The team that finished in the higher regular season place, played the first, third and the fifth (if it was necessary) games of the series at home. {| class=wikitable style="text-align:center" !style="width:275px; text- align:right;"|Team 1 !style="width:80px;"| !style="width:275px; text- align:left;"|Team 2 !style="width:70px;"|Game 1 !style="width:70px;"|Game 2 !style="width:70px;"|Game 3 !style="width:70px;"|Game 4 !style="width:70px;"|Game 5 |- | align=right|Alba Fehérvár || 3–1 || align=left|Zalakerámia ZTE KK || 80–88 || 94–85 || 102–70 || 79–74 || — |- | align=right|Falco-Vulcano Energia KC Szombathely || 3–0 || align=left|EGIS Körmend || 89–88 || 81–78 || 88–84 || — || — |} ===Finals=== In the finals, teams playing against each other had to win three games to win the title. Thus, if one team won three games before all five games were played, the remaining games were omitted. The team that finished in the higher regular season place, played the first, the third, and the fifth (if it was necessary) games of the series at home. {| class=wikitable style="text-align:center" !style="width:275px; text-align:right;"|Team 1 !style="width:80px;"| !style="width:275px; text-align:left;"|Team 2 !style="width:70px;"|Game 1 !style="width:70px;"|Game 2 !style="width:70px;"|Game 3 !style="width:70px;"|Game 4 !style="width:70px;"|Game 5 |- | align=right|Alba Fehérvár || 3–2 || align=left|Falco-Vulcano Energia KC Szombathely || 76–77 || 75–65 || 86–77 || 69–82 || 78–71 |} ====Game 1==== ====Game 2==== ====Game 3==== ====Game 4==== ====Game 5==== Alba Fehérvár won the FINAL series. ===Third place=== In the series for the third place, teams playing against each other had to win two games to win the 3rd place in the final rankings of the season. Thus, if one team won two games before all three games had been played, the remaining games were omitted. The team that finished in the higher regular season place, played the first and the third (if it was necessary) games of the series at home. {| class=wikitable style="text-align:center" !style="width:275px; text- align:right;"|Team 1 !style="width:80px;"| !style="width:275px; text- align:left;"|Team 2 !style="width:70px;"|Game 1 !style="width:70px;"|Game 2 !style="width:70px;"|Game 3 |- | align=right|EGIS Körmend || 0–2 || align=left|Zalakerámia ZTE KK || 94–107 || 95–99 || — |} ==Playout== Higher ranked team hosted Game 1 plus Game 3 if necessary. The lower ranked hosted Game 2. {| class=wikitable style="text-align:center" !style="width:275px; text-align:right;"|Team 1 !style="width:80px;"| !style="width:275px; text- align:left;"|Team 2 !style="width:70px;"|Game 1 !style="width:70px;"|Game 2 !style="width:70px;"|Game 3 |- | align=right|Vasas Budapest || 2–1 || align=left|MAFC || 79–73 || 68–81 || 84–78 |} ==Season statistics==
